input_text:
Job Title: Engineering Project Manager / Project Manager

Location: Madison, WI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Job Description ﻿Responsibilities: Specific Duties, Activities and Responsibilities include but are not limited to: 1. Responsible for project management execution and management of a team that delivers the initiation, design, construction, commissioning and operational start-up of business initiatives / goals, programs, manufacturing equipment, facilities, laboratories and office buildings. 2. Ensures that project delivery methodologies, project management processes/principles and project management tools are utilized to achieve project goals. Owns the key project management business processes and improves and simplifies these processes continuously. 3. Partners proactively and aligns with key internal customers to develop and execute capital projects that support business objectives. 4. Partners proactively with other group/function managers with strategic partners (Finance, Procurement, etc.) to support business objectives, streamline business processes impacting project planning/execution, and implement business process changes. 5. Delivers successful projects, effectively balancing quality, scope, cost and schedule. 6. Provides guidance, direction and advice to area PM’s (contract and site) with respect to actions or decisions related to changes in project scope, schedule and cost. 7. Manages the project controls function in support of active capital projects. 8. Analyzes and reviews the capital forecast and other planning tools to assess resource requirements and help determine staffing requirements. 9. Provides feedback and guidance to project staff. 10. Support Manufacturing and/or Facilities personnel in trouble-shooting problems in the operation of pharmaceutical and industrial manufacturing facility systems and equipment. 11. Per the above, strategizes on what modifications or investments might be required to accommodate the new client business onto our network assets. 12. Follows corporate standards and best practices. Education or Equivalent: BS/MS in Engineering discipline with experience in PM role for CGT/Bio projects. Experience: • Bachelor's degree in Chemical/Mechanical Engineering; Advanced Degree in technical / business area a plus. • Clear technical experience in design and operation of CGT technologies. • 5-10 years of engineering related experience • 5 years in BioPharm/CGT Industry experience • Previous role accountable for Project Management of $10M+ of value

Experience Level (if available): None
